gurmukhi: ieiq duqIAw gurU brnnM iDAwie smwpqM ]
transliteration: It(i) Douteeaa Guroo Barnanan Dhiaae Samaaptan||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Description of the second Guru.”

gurmukhi: jb dÍY su kIny gurU d`q dyvM ] sdw eyk ic`qM krY inq syvM ] jtw jUt sIsM su gMgw qrMgM ] kbY CÍY skw AMg ko nw AnMgM ]118]
transliteration: Jab Dve Su Keene Guroo Datt Devan|| Sakaa Ek Chittan Darainit Sevan|| Jata Jeet Seesan Sudgadgad Taranadg|| Kabai Chhvai Sakaa An Ko Naa Ananadg||118||
translation: When Dutt adopted two Guru and he always served them single-mindedly; the waves of the Ganges and the matted locks were auspiciously seated on his head and the god of love could never touch his body.118.

gurmukhi: mhw au`jlI AMg ibBUq sohY ] lKY mon mwnI mhw mwn mohY ] jtw jUt gMgw qrMgM mhwnM ] mhw bu`D au`dwr ib`idAw inDwnM ]119]
transliteration: Mahaa Ujjalian Bibhoot Sohai|| Lakhai Mon Maanimahaa Maan Mohai|| Jata Jeet Gadgad Taranadg Mahaanan|| Mahaa Buddh Uddaar Biddiaa Nidhaanan||119||
translation: There were white ashes smeared on his body and he was alluring the mind of very honoured persons; the sage appeared very great with the waves of the Ganges and matted locks; he was the treasure of generous wisdom and learning.119.

gurmukhi: Bgau hY lsY bsqR lMgot bMdM ] qjy srb Awsw rtY eyk CMdM ]
transliteration: Bhagadddhai Lasai Bastra Lanot Bandan|| Taje Sarab Aasaa Ratai Ek Chhandan||
translation: He wore ochre-coloured clothes and also the loin-cloth; he had forsaken all the expectations and recited only one mantra;

gurmukhi: mhw mon mwnI mhw mon bwNDo ] mhw jog krmM sBY nXws swDy ]120]
transliteration: Mahaa Mon Maanimahaa Mon Baandhe|| Mahaa Jog Karamannd Sabhai Nyaas Saadhe||120||
translation: He was a great silence-observer and practiced of all the practices of that actions of Yoga.120.

gurmukhi: dXw isMD srbM suBM krm krqw ] hry srb grbM mhwN qyj Drqw ]
transliteration: Dayaa Sindh Saraban Soubhan Karam Kartaa|| Dare Sarab Gadaban Mahaan Tej Dhartaa||
translation: He was greatly glorious as the ocean of mercy, the doer of good actions and the smasher of the pride of all;

gurmukhi: mhwN jog kI swDnw srb swDI ] mhwN mon mwnI mhwN is`D lwDI ]121]
transliteration: Mahaan Jog Kisaadhanaa Sarab Saadhee|| Mahaan Mon Maanimahaan Siddh Laakhee||121||
translation: He was the practiser of all the practices of great Yoga and was a purusha of silence observation and the discoverer of the great powers.121.

gurmukhi: auTY pRwq sMiDAw krY nHwn jwvY ] krY swDnw jog kI jog BwvY ]
transliteration: Outhai Praat Sandhiaa Darai Nahaan Jaavai|| Darai Saadhanaa Jog Kijog Bhaavai||
translation: He used to go for a bath in the mornings and evenings and practiced Yoga;

gurmukhi: qiRkwl`ig drsI mhw prm q`qM ] su sMnXws dyvM mhw su`D m`qM ]122]
transliteration: Trikaalagg(i) Darsimahaa Param Tattan|| Su Sannyaas Devan Mahaa Suddh Mattan||122||
translation: He could observe the past, present and future and was divinely-incarnate saint of pure intellect amongst all the Sannyasis.122.

gurmukhi: ipXwsw CuDw Awn kY jo sqwvY ] rhY eyk ic`qM n ic`qM clwvY ]
transliteration: Piyaasaa Chhudhaa Aan Kai Jo Sataavai|| Rahai Ek Chittan Na Chittan Chalaavai||
translation: He did not allow his mind to become mercurial even on being afflicted by hunger and thirst;

gurmukhi: krY jog nXwsM inrwsM audwsI ] Dry myKlw prm qqM pRkwSI ]123]
transliteration: Darai Jog Nyaasan Niraasan Udaasee|| Ddare Medhlaa Param Tatan Prakaadhee||123||
translation: He, remaining supremely unattached, and wearing the patched cloak, practiced Yoga, for the realization of the light of the Supreme Essence.123.
